page.title: 08FARMING
page.content: On the minto hill's there is alot of rough grazing for sheep and cattle. In the flat valley land farmers grow oilseed rape and grain.There are only a few fields used for growing oilseed rape,barley and good grass for grazing,hay or silage.There are four types of sheep these being sufolk, blue leicester,grey faces cheviots. Honeyburn is the dairy farm and has 35 friesians.They sow barley,grass, oilseed rape and turnips.It is marshy in some places.Ten cows can be milked in the parlour at one time.The cows are fed on silage,hay,grass and cake.The farm has three pits of silage a year.Some of the milk goes to a bigger farm called Orchard farm which retails its own milk.Honeyburn is the main dairy farm the rest tend to be mixed farms or arable.
